xyz.swatt.string

Class StringHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • xyz.swatt.string.StringHelper

  • public class StringHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    A Helper class to preform common and/or complex String manipulations.
    Author:
    Brandon Dudek (BrandonDudek)

    • Method Detail

      • htmlEscapeNonAsciiPrintCharacters

        public static java.lang.String htmlEscapeNonAsciiPrintCharacters(java.lang.String _string,
                                                                 StringHelper.NumberBase _numberBase)
        Will Replace all Non-ASCII (table 1) characters (and non-print ASCII [table 1] characters) with their XML Escaped equivalent.

        Note: Same as calling xmlEscapeNonAsciiPrintCharacters(String, NumberBase).

        Parameters:
        _string - The String to Escape.
        _numberBase - The Number System to Escape to.
        Returns:
        The given String with all the appropriate characters replaced; or null, if null is given.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given StringHelper.NumberBase is null or unknown.
        See Also:
        xmlEscapeNonAsciiPrintCharacters(String, NumberBase)

      • xmlEscapeNonAsciiPrintCharacters

        public static java.lang.String xmlEscapeNonAsciiPrintCharacters(java.lang.String _string,
                                                                StringHelper.NumberBase _numberBase)
        Will Replace all Non-ASCII (table 1) characters (and non-print ASCII [table 1] characters) with their XML Escaped equivalent.

        Note: Same as calling XmlDocumentHelper.escapeExtendedCharacters(String, XmlDocumentHelper.XmlEntityFormat).

        Parameters:
        _string - The String to Escape.
        _numberBase - The Number System to Escape to.
        Returns:
        The given String with all the appropriate characters replaced; or null, if null is given.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given StringHelper.NumberBase is null or unknown.
        See Also:
        XmlDocumentHelper.escapeExtendedCharacters(String, XmlDocumentHelper.XmlEntityFormat)

      • normalize

        public static java.lang.String normalize(java.lang.String _string)
        Replaces all contiguous Whitespace characters with one space.

        Note: Same as calling StringHelper.replace(_string, " ", CharacterPosition.ANYWHERE, true, CharacterSet.ALL_WHITESPACE);.

        Parameters:
        _string - The input String to normalize.
        Returns:
        A normalized version of the input String.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the input string is null.

      • removeWhitespace

        public static java.lang.String removeWhitespace(java.lang.String _string)
        Removes whitespace, of all kinds, from the given string.

        Note: Same as calling StringHelper.replace(_string, "", CharacterPosition.ANYWHERE, false|true, CharacterSet.ALL_WHITESPACE);.

        (Similar to StringUtils.deleteWhitespace(String); but thos method removed more "whitespace" characters.

        Parameters:
        _string - The string to remove the whitespace from.
        Returns:
        The input string with all of the whitespace removed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the input string is null.

      • replace

        public static java.lang.String replace(java.lang.String _haystack,
                                       java.lang.String _replacement,
                                       StringHelper.CharacterPosition _position,
                                       boolean _normalize,
                                       StringHelper.CharacterSet... _characterSet)
        Replaces all characters of the given Character Set with the given replacement String.
        Parameters:
        _haystack - The String to do the Search and Replace on.
        _replacement - The String use as a replacement.
        _position - Where in the _haystack to search for the _characterSets.
        _normalize - If true, every contiguous batch of characters in the given Character Set will be replaced with just one instance of the replacement String; otherwise, all characters get replaced with the replacement String.
        _characterSet - The Character Set to replace.
        Returns:
        The input String with the given Character Set replaced by the given replacement String.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the haystack string is null or no StringHelper.CharacterSet is given.

      • replaceLast

        public static java.lang.String replaceLast(java.lang.String _haystack,
                                           java.lang.String _needle,
                                           java.lang.String _replacement)
        Same as String.replaceFirst(String, String), except it replaces the last occurrence and the "_needle" is NOT a REGEX.
        Parameters:
        _haystack - The String to do the Search and Replace on.
        _needle - The substring to search for and replace.
        _replacement - The new VALUE to be put in place of the search String.
        Returns:
        The new string, with the replacement made, if the substring was found; or the original String, if the substring was not found.

      • toFile

        public java.io.File toFile(java.lang.String _string,
                           java.io.File _file,
                           java.nio.file.OpenOption... _options)
        Will write the given String to the given File.

        Note: If the file does not exit, it will be created, along with any missing path folders. Or if the File Exists, it will be overwritten.

        Parameters:
        _string - The String to be written to the File.
        _file - The File to write the String into.
        _options - Optional File Open Options to overwrite default behavior (see: StandardOpenOption).
        Returns:
        The given File for method call chaining.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given String or File are null.

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(java.io.File _file)
        Converts a File into a String.
        Parameters:
        _file - The file to pull the data out of and put in a String.
        Returns:
        The contents of the File, or null, if the file could not be found.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If _file is null.

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(java.io.InputStream _stream)
        Converts an InputStream into a String.

        Note: The given Input Stream is closed.

        Parameters:
        _stream - The Input Stream to pull data from and put in a String.
        Returns:
        The converted contents of the InputStream, or an Empty String, if the InputStream is empty.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If _stream is null.

      • trim

        public static java.lang.String trim(java.lang.String _string)
        Will remove all whitespace from the Beginning and End of the given string.

        Note: Same as calling StringHelper.replace(_string, "", CharacterPosition.BEGINNING_OR_END, true, CharacterSet.ALL_WHITESPACE);.

        Parameters:
        _string - The String to trim;
        Returns:
        A trimmed version of the given String.
